alert.note: Alert for Stanley (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 5:43PM MDT until June 24 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT/615 PM MDT/ FOR WESTERN SULLY...SOUTHWESTERN POTTER... NORTHWESTERN STANLEY AND SOUTHEASTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 643 PM CDT/543 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Lake Oahe to 7 miles south of Mission Ridge, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Swiftbird, Swiftbird Day School and Whitlocks Bay Rec Area. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
